Comments_List: You learn about the history of Russian active measures and how the Kremlin strategy developed from the Soviet Union until the 2016 presidential election. You also learn about how social media and the digital age has changed social capital and America and evaluate potential policy solutions to these problems.
I learned a lot about subversion methods and Russia infiltration of our media in this course.
Knowledge about Russian active measures and interference in 2016 election via social media

Strengths: evaluate these issues through multiple different lenses - psychological, domestic, and international - so you really develop a broad understanding of disinformation. Weaknesses: some of the readings were a bit dense and some weeks had 300+ pages of reading.
I feel like the nature of an online class is that people tend to zone out more and participate less so I hope this course does change into a regular classroom based course.
YES! I learned a lot from Professor Rangappa and her background as an FBI agent offered a special perspective.
I would, I think I learned a lot of information.
Yes, very topical and interesting material!
